result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Joseph Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
*Defendant to pay DNA and DV surcharges by 10/17/2016, in the alternative serve 10 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 10 day time served.
*Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: With credit for 60 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin Joseph Pearson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail forfeiture hearing. DZ
Bail forfeiture hearing. DZ
ADA Alex Mueller appeared for the state.  Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeds.  In Court is Surety, Shirley Pearson .  Statements made by both parties.  Court orders bail/bond to remain forfeited.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 12-16-2016 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Maxine White. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
REQUESTS FOR BAIL FORFEITURE HEARING,  (PEARSON, S.) FILED
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($150.00) gj
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) gj

AS TO COUNT 1
Court sentenced defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction, concurrent, with credit for 60 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample. 

Defendant to pay DNA and DV surcharges by 10/17/2016, in the alternative serve 10 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 10 day time served.

Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. 

Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form and Notice of RIght to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Defendant PRODUCED. Parties have reached an agreement. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Devin Joseph Pearson not in court, in custody.  Porchia Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. First call- Parties ready to proceed to trial. Court ordered case passed to address court calendar.
Received and Filed, Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed, Defendant's requested Jury Instructions.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Devin Joseph Pearson not in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. Case adjourned to branch 24 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 10/17/2016.

Attorney Angel Johnson in court, defendant Devin Joseph Pearson not in court, in custody.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised No Contact/No Firearms Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with VAS (DOB 4/6/89) or her son. Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devin Joseph Pearson in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Devin Joseph Pearson in custody.  May Y. Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez informed of case being called.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. NO FILE IN COURT. Discussion of Justice Point violation reports placed on the record.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT. Court ordered any bail on deposit be forfeited. Court VACATES Jury Trial date.

Defendant Devin Joseph Pearson in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. For reasons placed on the record, state requests an adjourned Jury Trial. Court grants state request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devin Joseph Pearson in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case scheduled for Jury Trial on 4/4/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to branch 24.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
